intro: Didactyle plumosa, commonly known as the featherleaf lichen, is a unique species belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery thallus structure, which gives it its common name. The plant exhibits a pale to dark green or yellowish coloration, often with a powdery or granular coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on bark or stone in temperate regions. Didactyle plumosa plays a vital role in ecological systems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
